item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Alison Croggon
item.description: "Love is one of the true mysteries,' he said at last. 'The truest and the deepest of all. One thing, Maerad: to love is never wrong. It may be disastrous; it may never be possible; it may be the deepest agony. But it is never wrong." -- Alison Croggon

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Georgette Heyer
item.description: "You're only a man! You've not our gifts! I can tell you! Why, a woman can think of a hundred different things at once, all them contradictory!" -- Georgette Heyer

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Some of you say, “Joy is greater than sorrow,” and others say, “Nay, sorrow is the greater.” But I say unto you, they are inseparable. Together they come, and when one sits alone with you at your board, remember that the other is asleep upon your bed." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need. " -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Open your eyes and then open your eyes again." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Crivens!" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Wilmot
item.description: "Before I got married I had six theories about raising children; now, I have six children and no theories." -- John Wilmot

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Once I spoke the language of the flowers, Once I understood each word the caterpillar said, Once I smiled in secret at the gossip of the starlings, And shared a conversation with the housefly in my bed. Once I heard and answered all the questions of the crickets, And joined the crying of each falling dying flake of snow, Once I spoke the language of the flowers. . . . How did it go? How did it go?" -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by A.A. Milne
Jennifer add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Morning is an important time of day, because how you spend your morning can often tell you what kind of day you are going to have." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "If you want sweet dreams, you've got to live a sweet life." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Andy Hunt
item.description: "Only dead fish go with the flow." -- Andy Hunt

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The earth laughs in flowers." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career. " -- C.S. Lewis
